chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: R
m: R
n: R

Goal:
p > 0 -> p * n >= p * m -> n >= m

Premises:
*** [ R : Set ]
Rmult_ge_compat_l : forall n m p : R, m >= n -> p >= 0 -> p * m >= p * n
Rmult_ge_neg_compat_l : forall n m p : R, m >= n -> 0 >= p -> p * n >= p * m
Rmult_gt_compat_l : forall n m p : R, n > m -> p > 0 -> p * n > p * m
Rmult_gt_neg_compat_l : forall n m p : R, m > n -> 0 > p -> p * n > p * m
BinIntDef.Z.of_N = fun n : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%Z | N.pos p => Z.pos p end : N -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_N _%N_scope
pos = fun p : posreal => let (pos, _) := p in pos : posreal -> R pos is a coercion
IZR_ge : forall n m : Z, (n >= m)%Z -> IZR n >= IZR m
BinNatDef.N.to_nat = fun a : N => match a with | 0%N => 0%nat | N.pos p => Pos.to_nat p end : N -> nat Arguments BinNatDef.N.to_nat _%N_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0%Z => 1%Z | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0%Z end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Cauchy_crit = fun Un : nat -> R => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n m : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> (m >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) (Un m) < eps : (nat -> R) -> Prop Arguments Cauchy_crit _%function_scope
Z.le_ge : forall n m : Z, (n <= m)%Z -> (m >= n)%Z
Nat2Z.inj_ge : forall n m : nat, (n >= m)%nat < -> (Z.of_nat n >= Z.of_nat m)%Z
Rge_sign_neg_pos_rev : forall x y : R, 0 > x -> 0 >= x * y -> y >= 0
Rge_sign_pos_pos_rev : forall x y : R, x > 0 -> x * y >= 0 -> y >= 0
Rge_sign_neg_neg_rev : forall x y : R, 0 > x -> x * y >= 0 -> 0 >= y
Rge_sign_pos_neg_rev : forall x y : R, x > 0 -> 0 >= x * y -> 0 >= y
Rmult_ge_compat : forall r1 r2 r3 r4 : R, r2 >= 0 -> r4 >= 0 -> r1 >= r2 -> r3 >= r4 -> r1 * r3 >= r2 * r4
Rge_sign_pos_pos : forall x y : R, x >= 0 -> y >= 0 -> x * y >= 0
Rge_sign_pos_neg : forall x y : R, x >= 0 -> 0 >= y -> 0 >= x * y
Rge_sign_neg_pos : forall x y : R, 0 >= x -> y >= 0 -> 0 >= x * y
Rge_sign_neg_neg : forall x y : R, 0 >= x -> 0 >= y -> x * y >= 0
Rmult_ge_compat_r : forall r r1 r2 : R, r >= 0 -> r1 >= r2 -> r1 * r >= r2 * r
RIneq.Rmult_ge_compat_l : forall r r1 r2 : R, r >= 0 -> r1 >= r2 -> r * r1 >= r * r2
IZR_le : forall n m : Z, (n <= m)%Z -> IZR n <= IZR m
Pow_x_infinity : forall x : R, Rabs x > 1 -> forall b : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> Rabs (x ^ n) >= b
Ratan_is_ps_atan : forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> forall x : R, -1 < x -> x < 1 -> Rabs (sum_f_R0 (tg_alt (Ratan_seq x)) n - ps_atan x) < eps
get_signZ = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.neg p => Some (Z.pos p) | _ => None end : Z -> option Z Arguments get_signZ _%Z_scope
Un_cv = fun (Un : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Arguments Un_cv _%function_scope _%R_scope
infinite_sum = fun (s : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (sum_f_R0 s n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Arguments infinite_sum _%function_scope _%R_scope
Ratan_seq = fun (x : R) (n : nat) => x ^ (2 * n + 1) / INR (2 * n + 1) : R -> nat -> R Arguments Ratan_seq _%R_scope _%nat_scope
IZN : forall n : Z, (0 <= n)%Z -> exists m : nat, n = Z.of_nat m
Rmult_ge_0_gt_0_lt_compat : forall r1 r2 r3 r4 : R, r3 >= 0 -> r2 > 0 -> r1 < r2 -> r3 < r4 -> r1 * r3 < r2 * r4
PI_tg = fun n : nat => / INR (2 * n + 1) : nat -> R Arguments PI_tg _%nat_scope
Zle_minus_le_0 : forall n m : Z, (m <= n)%Z -> (0 <= n - m)%Z
dist : forall m : Metric_Space, Base m -> Base m -> R
Rmult_le_ge_compat_neg_l : forall r r1 r2 : R, r <= 0 -> r1 <= r2 -> r * r1 >= r * r2
Rplus_gt_reg_neg_r : forall r1 r2 r3 : R, 0 >= r2 -> r1 + r2 > r3 -> r1 > r3
Zle_bool_imp_le : forall n m : Z, (n <=? m)%Z = true -> (n <= m)%Z
Ztac.Zlt_le_add_1 : forall n m : Z, (n < m)%Z -> (n + 1 <= m)%Z
